Class PUserApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.internalapi.PUserApp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class PUserApp
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    UserApp object that can be used on the client side.

    roehrdor

      • sensorProhibited

        public boolean sensorProhibited(int id)
        Check whether the current user settings prohibit the use of the given sensor for the underlying application
        Parameters:
        id - the sensor id
        Returns:
        true if the application is not allowed to use data from the given sensor

      • grantPermission

        public boolean grantPermission(int id)
        Allow the application to use data from the given sensor. This permission is given until it is revoked again by calling UserApp.revokePermission(int). Note this function will return false if the permission for the sensor is already granted.
        Parameters:
        id - the sensor id
        Returns:
        true if the permission has not been granted yet and the permission has been changed

      • revokePermission

        public boolean revokePermission(int id)
        Revoke the permission for the application to use data from the given sensor. This permission is revoked until it is granted again by calling UserApp.grantPermission(int). Note this function will return false if the permission for the given sensor has already been revoked and never been granted again.
        Parameters:
        id - the sensor id to revoke permissions for
        Returns:
        true if revoked successfully

      • denySensorType

        public boolean denySensorType(int flag)
        Allow the user application to use data from the sensor type. If this settings prohibits the use of a sensor type all data from corresponding sensors all requests will be automatically denied. To restrict only a single sensor from multiple sensors for the same type use the function UserApp.revokePermission(int). The permission for the sensor type is denied until it is granted again by calling the UserApp.allowSensorType(int) method.
        Parameters:
        flag - the sensor type permission flag to deny usage of
        Returns:
        true if the usage is now denied

      • allowSensorType

        public boolean allowSensorType(int flag)
        Allow the user application to use data from the given sensor type. Only in this state the use of UserApp.grantPermission(int) makes sense for sensors of the given sensor type. The permission of this sensor type is granted until UserApp.denySensorType(int) is called with the same argument.
        Parameters:
        flag - the sensor type permission flag to allow usage of
        Returns:
        true if the usage is now permitted

      • sensorTypeGranted

        public boolean sensorTypeGranted(int flag)
        Tests whether the application is allowed to use this type of sensor.
        Parameters:
        flag - the sensor type permission flag
        Returns:
        true if the permission is granted

      • grantActivityRecognition

        public void grantActivityRecognition()
        Grant the application the usage of data gained based on the activity recognition process

      • denyActivityRecognition

        public void denyActivityRecognition()
        Revoke the permission to use data gained based on the activity recognition process

      • activityRecognitionGranted

        public boolean activityRecognitionGranted()
        Return whether the application is allowed to use data gained from the activity recognition process
        Returns:
        true if the application is allowed to use data gained from the activity recognition process
